intro: Cypella cyrtophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cypella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
